page.title: 01Chickney, NW Essex upland
page.content: This is a pleasant rural scene for the most part gently undulating with farmland and woods. It comprises the sparsely populated hamlets of Chickney Hamperden End, Cutler's Green, Sibleys, Sucksted Green and Chaureth Green. Part of it lies within the parish of Thaxted, and part in Broxted. There are 14 farms, although some of them have become dwelling houses with gardens and perhaps a paddock, while the adjoining land has been bought by a farmer who now owns an acreage formerly occupied by 2 or 3 farms. Many hedges have been removed to make large fields and to facilitate the sowing and harvesting of crops with modern machinery. The whole area is covered by about 12 miles of minor roads otherwise the land is crossed by farm-tracks, private drives or footpaths.
